apiKeys_rotateWarningBody: Click the button below to generate a new API key. You'll only see it once, so make sure to copy it.
apiKeys_rotateWarningTitle: Generating a new key will invalidate your old key
apiKeys_saveKeyNowBody: This key will not be shown again. Copy it now and store it securely.
auth_demoModeBody: You're about to log in to a demo account. Use the credentials below to explore Scanopy. Note that some actions are disabled in demo mode, and rate limiting is set to strict.
auth_passwordUpdatedBody: Your password has been successfully reset. You can now sign in with your new password.
auth_resetLinkSentBody: If an account exists with that email, you'll receive a password reset link shortly. Please check your inbox and spam folder.
auth_resetPasswordInstructions: Enter your email address and we'll send you a link to reset your password.
auth_signUpForUpdates: Sign up for product updates via email
auth_termsAndPrivacy: I agree to the terms and privacy policy
auth_youreAllSetBodyMultiple: Register to finish setup. Your daemons will begin scanning "{networkNames}" and populating your network map.
auth_youreAllSetBodySingle: Register to finish setup. Your daemon will begin scanning "{networkNames}" and populating your network map.
auth_youreInvitedBody: You have been invited to join {orgName} by {invitedBy}. Please sign in or register to continue.
billing_inquiryFailed: Unable to send inquiry. Please contact sales@scanopy.net directly.
billing_inquiryLabel: What information are you looking for?
billing_inquiryPlaceholder: Tell us what you'd like to know about the {planName} plan...
billing_inquirySuccess: Thanks for your interest! We'll be in touch soon.
billing_subscriptionDelayed: Subscription is taking longer than expected to activate. Please refresh the page.
common_apiKeyNameHelp: A friendly name to help you identify this key
common_areYouSure: Are you sure you want to proceed?
common_confirmDeleteName: Are you sure you want to delete "{name}"?
common_couldNotLoadUser: Could not load ID for current user
common_expirationNeverHelp: Leave empty for keys that never expire
common_failedToCopyId: Failed to copy ID to clipboard: {error}
common_networkRequired: At least one network must be selected
cookies_analyticsDesc: Help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting anonymous usage data.
cookies_necessaryDesc: Essential cookies required for the website to function. These cannot be disabled.
cookies_preferencesDesc: Manage your cookie preferences below. You can enable or disable different types of cookies. See our privacy policy for more details.
cookies_settingsDesc: We use cookies to improve your experience and analyze site traffic. See our privacy policy for details.
daemonApiKeys_confirmBulkDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {count} Daemon API Keys?
daemonApiKeys_confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete daemon API key "{name}"?
daemonApiKeys_enableApiKeyHelp: Manually enable or disable API Key. Will be auto-disabled if used in a request after expiry date passes.
daemonApiKeys_namePlaceholder: e.g., Production Daemon Key, Terraform Deployment
daemonApiKeys_noApiKeysYet: No Daemon API Keys configured yet
daemonApiKeys_noNetworkAvailable: No network available. Please create a network first.
daemons_activateAfterCreation: Your daemon will activate after account creation
daemons_activateAfterCreationBody: To visualize your network, Scanopy needs to discover what's on it. Install the daemon belowâ€”after registration, it'll connect and start mapping automatically.
daemons_apiKeyHelp: This will create a new API key, which you can manage later in the API Keys tab.
daemons_binaryInstallationHelp: Run the install script to upgrade to the latest version. This will replace the existing binary.
daemons_config_allowSelfSignedCertsHelp: Allow self-signed certs for daemon -> server connections
daemons_config_apiKeyHelp: Authentication key for daemon (generated via UI)
daemons_config_arpPacketsPerSecondHelp: Maximum ARP packets per second (default: 50, go more conservative for networks with enterprise switches)
daemons_config_arpRetriesHelp: Number of ARP retry rounds for non-responding hosts (default: 2, meaning 3 total attempts)
daemons_config_bindAddressHelp: IP address to bind daemon to
daemons_config_daemonUrlHelp: Public URL where server can reach daemon in Push mode. Defaults to auto-detected IP + Daemon Port if not set
daemons_config_dockerProxyHelp: Optional proxy for Docker API. Can use both non-SSL and SSL proxy; SSL proxy requires additional SSL config vars
daemons_config_dockerProxySslCertHelp: Path to SSL certificate if using a docker proxy with SSL
daemons_config_dockerProxySslChainHelp: Path to SSL chain if using a docker proxy with SSL
daemons_config_dockerProxySslKeyHelp: Path to SSL private key if using a docker proxy with SSL
daemons_config_heartbeatIntervalHelp: Seconds between heartbeat updates / work requests (for daemons in pull mode) to server
daemons_config_interfacesHelp: Restrict daemon to specific network interface(s). Comma-separated for multiple (e.g., eth0,eth1). Leave empty for all interfaces. Only applies to network discovery
daemons_config_modeHelp: Select whether the daemon will Pull work from the server or have work Pushed to it. If set to Push, you will need to ensure that network you are deploying the daemon on can be reached by the server by opening/forwarding the port to the daemon, and provide the Daemon URL where the server should try to reach the daemon. If set to Pull, no port opening/forwarding is needed
daemons_config_namePlaceholder: Enter a name for this daemon...
daemons_config_networkIdHelp: UUID of the network to scan
daemons_config_portHelp: Port for daemon to listen on
daemons_config_serverUrlHelp: URL where the daemon can reach the server
daemons_config_useNpcapArp: Use Npcap for ARP on Windows
daemons_config_useNpcapArpHelp: Enable faster ARP scanning on Windows by using broadcast ARP via Npcap instead of native SendARP, which doesn't support broadcast. **Requires Npcap installation**. Ignored on Linux/macOS
daemons_confirmBulkDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {count} Daemons?
daemons_confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete daemon @"{name}"?
daemons_dockerApplyChanges: Then run docker compose up -d to apply the changes.
daemons_dockerLatestTag: If you're using the :latest tag, pull the new image and restart:
daemons_dockerPinnedVersion: If you're pinned to a specific version, update the image line in your
daemons_fixValidationErrorsBody: Correct the field validation issues above before using the installation commands.
daemons_generateNewKeyHelp: Generate a new key if this is a fresh daemon setup.
daemons_keyNotAvailableWarning: This API key will not be available once you close this modal. Please use the provided run command or update your docker compose with the API key as depicted below.
daemons_networkCannotChange: Network cannot be changed after API key is generated
daemons_option1Text: Run the install script, then start the daemon
daemons_restartDaemon: After updating, restart the daemon service for changes to take effect.
daemons_stopDaemonContainer: Stop the daemon container, and add this environment variable
daemons_stopDaemonProcess: Stop the daemon process, and use this command to start it
daemons_updateAvailable: An update is available for daemon
daemons_useExistingKeyHelp: Use an existing key if your organization manages API keys centrally or you've already generated one.
discovery_adHocDescription: This discovery will only run when manually triggered
discovery_allSubnetsScanned: All subnets in network will be scanned
discovery_confirmDeleteHistorical: Are you sure you want to delete {count} Historical Discoveries?
discovery_confirmDeleteScheduled: Are you sure you want to delete {count} Scheduled Discoveries?
discovery_couldNotGetNetworkId: Could not get network ID from selected daemon. Please try a different daemon.
discovery_daemonHelp: The daemon that will execute this discovery
discovery_daemonHostMissingHelp: Could not find a host associated to the selected daemon. It may have been deleted or corrupted. Please recreate the daemon.
discovery_hostNameFallbackHelp: In the event that hostname can't be resolved, what name should be set for discovered hosts? IP Address, or best service (the highest confidence service match)?
discovery_manualDiscoveryHelp: This discovery will only run when you manually trigger it from the discoveries page. No automatic scheduling is configured.
discovery_namePlaceholder: e.g., Daily Network Scan, Docker Services Check
discovery_noDaemonSelected: No daemon selected; can't set up discovery
discovery_noHistorySessions: No discovery sessions have been run
discovery_nonInterfacedSubnetWarning:
The selected daemon does not have a direct network interface with the following subnets: 
{subnets}. 
You can still include them, but hostnames and MAC addresses will not be available for any discovered hosts.
discovery_scheduleHelp: Configure how often this discovery should run automatically
discovery_scheduledDescription: This discovery will run automatically on a schedule
discovery_targetSubnetsHelp: Select specific subnets to scan, or leave empty to scan all subnets that the daemon has an interface with.
errors_auth_daemon_key_not_created: Daemon is trying to register with an API key that has not yet been created
errors_auth_oidc_not_configured: OIDC not configured for this organization
errors_auth_organization_required: This operation requires an organization context
errors_auth_permission_denied: You don't have permission to perform this action
errors_auth_session_expired: Your session has expired. Please log in again.
errors_billing_plan_limit_reached: You've reached the limit of {limit} {resource} on your current plan
errors_daemon_identity_mismatch: Cannot send updates for a different daemon
errors_daemon_network_mismatch: Cannot send updates for a different network
errors_database_duplicate_entry: A record with this {field} already exists
errors_discovery_historical_read_only: Historical discovery cannot be modified via API
errors_discovery_subnet_network_mismatch: Subnet '{subnet}' is on a different network
errors_entity_access_denied: You don't have access to this {entity}

errors_entity_reference_invalid: Referenced {entity} in field '{field}' does not exist
errors_interface_ip_out_of_range: IP address '{ip}' is not within subnet '{subnet}' range
errors_invite_already_accepted: This invite has already been accepted
errors_invite_email_mismatch: Invite email doesn't match your account
errors_networks_access_denied: You don't have access to network '{network}'
errors_rate_limit_exceeded: Too many requests, please try again later
errors_validation_bulk_empty: No IDs provided for bulk operation
errors_validation_max_length: Field '{field}' must be at most {max} characters
errors_validation_min_length: Field '{field}' must be at least {min} characters

hosts_consolidateModal_warningBody: The source host will be permanently deleted and converted to an interface. Make sure this is what you want before proceeding.
hosts_details_descriptionPlaceholder: Describe what this host does or its role in your infrastructure

hosts_editor_basicInfo: Basic host information and connection details
hosts_editor_virtualizationDesc: VMs and containers managed by services on this host
hosts_interfaces_deleteMessage: This interface has bindings from the following services. Deleting it will remove those bindings.

hosts_interfaces_helpText: Configure network interfaces and addresses. Drag to reorder.

hosts_ports_deleteMessage: This port has bindings from the following services. Deleting it will remove those bindings.
hosts_ports_emptyMessage: No ports on this host. Add one to get started.
hosts_ports_selectToConfig: Select a port from the list to configure it
hosts_ports_wellKnownSubtitle: This is a well-known or registered port, and can't be edited
hosts_services_bindingsHelp: For a given interface, a service can have either port bindings OR an interface binding, not both.
hosts_services_couldNotFindService: Could not find service to create binding for
hosts_services_couldNotFindServiceToRemo: Could not find service to remove binding for
hosts_services_emptyMessage: No services configured yet. Add one to get started.
hosts_services_helpText: Services define what this host provides to the network. The icon for the first service in the list will be used as the host's logo in the Host tab.
hosts_services_interfaceBindingsHelp: Service is present at an interface (IP address) without a specific port
hosts_services_noAvailablePortCombos: No available port+interface combinations to bind
hosts_services_noInterfaces: Host does not have any interfaces, can't create binding
hosts_services_noPorts: Host does not have any ports, can't create binding
hosts_services_portBindingsHelp: Service listens on a specific port, optionally on a specific interface
hosts_services_selectToConfig: Select a service from the list to configure it
hosts_virtualization_containerHelp: Manage containers controlled by this {serviceName} instance
hosts_virtualization_emptyMessage: No virtualization services on this host.
hosts_virtualization_noContainersYet: No containers managed by this service yet. Add services that run in containers on this host.
hosts_virtualization_noVmsYet: No VMs managed by this service yet. Add hosts that are VMs running on this hypervisor.
hosts_virtualization_pleaseSaveBody: You need to save {name} before managing virtualization
hosts_virtualization_selectToManage: Select a virtualization service from the list to manage its VMs or containers
hosts_virtualization_servicesHelp: Services that manage virtual machines or containers on this host
hosts_virtualization_unknownTypeSubtitle: This service has an unrecognized virtualization management type
hosts_virtualization_vmHelp: Manage VMs controlled by this {serviceName} instance

networks_confirmBulkDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {count} Networks?
networks_confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete network "{name}"? All hosts, groups, and subnets will be deleted along with it.
onboarding_commercialNoticeBody: Scanopy Community is licensed under AGPL-3.0. For commercial use, please ensure your use complies with the license terms, or consider our commercial self-hosted offering.
onboarding_compatibleBody: Scanopy can be deployed on your host.
onboarding_daemonInstallInfo: Install a daemon on any device on your network to start discovering hosts and services. We recommend installing at least one now so you can see your network visualized immediately after registration.
onboarding_daemonsActivateBody: If you install a daemon now, it'll connect and start mapping your network automatically after you register.
onboarding_dockerLinuxOnlyTitle: Docker Compose installation is only compatible with Linux hosts
onboarding_dockerLinuxWarning: Docker Compose deployment with network_mode: host is only fully supported on Linux.
onboarding_dockerMacWarning: Docker Compose deployment with network_mode: host is only fully supported on Linux. On macOS, you'll need to use the binary install method.
onboarding_dockerWindowsWarning: Docker Compose deployment with network_mode: host is only fully supported on Linux. On Windows, you'll need to use the binary install method.
onboarding_emailNewsUpdates: Also email me about product news and updates
onboarding_emailOptional: Optional - we'll follow up if we can help
onboarding_feedbackError: Failed to submit feedback. Please try again.
onboarding_feedbackPlaceholder: Tell us what you need help with...
onboarding_feedbackQuestion: What's blocking you from getting started?
onboarding_freebsdNotSupported: Scanopy's daemon currently doesn't support FreeBSD. We recommend running the daemon on a Linux host or VM on your network instead.
onboarding_installLaterHelp: You can install this daemon later by going to the Daemons tab and selecting "Create Daemon"
onboarding_installMethodQuestion: How will you install the network scanner?
onboarding_installNowHelp: Use the configuration tool below to install your daemon.
onboarding_letUsHelp: Let us help you get started
onboarding_mspNetworkHelp: Each network represents a customer environment. One customer can have multiple networks.
onboarding_openbsdNotSupported: Scanopy's daemon currently doesn't support OpenBSD. We recommend running the daemon on a Linux host or VM on your network instead.
onboarding_orgHelpText: Your company, team, or project name
onboarding_osNotSupported: This operating system is not currently supported.
onboarding_osQuestion: What is your host's operating system?
onboarding_readyToScan: Ready to scan a network and see it visualized?
onboarding_tailorSetup: We'll tailor the setup to your needs
onboarding_whatDoYouNeed: What do you need before starting?
services_confirmBulkDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {count} Services?
services_confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete "{serviceName}"?
services_subtitle: To create a service, add it to a host in the Hosts tab.
settings_account_oidcLinkHelp: Link your account with an identity provider for faster sign-in. You can only link one provider at a time.
settings_account_unlinkFirst: Unlink {provider} first to link this provider
settings_account_updateCredentials: Update your email address and/or password
settings_billing_canceled: Your subscription has been canceled. Access will end at the end of your billing period.
settings_billing_pastDue: Your payment is past due. Please update your payment method to continue using Scanopy.
settings_billing_trialActive: Your trial is active. You won't be charged until your trial ends.
settings_org_populateConfirm: Are you sure you want to populate demo data? This will add sample networks, hosts, and services to your organization.
settings_org_populateDemoHelp: Fill the organization with sample data for demonstration purposes.
settings_org_resetConfirm: Are you sure you want to reset all organization data? This will delete all entities and users from your organization. This action cannot be undone.
settings_org_resetDataHelp: Delete everything except for any organization owner user account. This cannot be undone.
shares_allowedDomainsHelp: Restrict which domains can embed this share. Leave empty to allow all domains.
shares_cacheInfoBody: Share links and embeds are cached. Any updates you make won't be visible immediately.
shares_cacheInfoTitle: Changes may take up to 5 minutes to appear
shares_confirmBulkDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {count} shares?
shares_createdHelp: To edit this share's settings, go to the Sharing tab.
shares_noSharesSubtitle: Create links or embeds from the Topology tab to share your topologies
shares_noSharesYet: No links or embeds created yet
shares_passwordHelpCreate: Leave empty to allow public access with no password
shares_passwordHelpEdit: Leave empty to keep the current password
shares_upgradeForEmbeds: Upgrade your plan to embed this share on external websites.
subnets_confirmBulkDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {count} Subnets?
subnets_descriptionPlaceholder: Describe the purpose of this subnet...
support_description: Need help with Scanopy? Choose one of the options below to get support.
support_discordDesc: Join our community for help and discussions
support_incorrectDetectionDesc: Report a service that was incorrectly identified
support_reportBugDesc: Found an issue? Let us know so we can fix it
support_requestFeatureDesc: Suggest a new feature or improvement
support_userGuideDesc: Read the full documentation and guides
tags_confirmBulkDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {count} tags?
tags_noTagsHelp: Tags help you organize and filter hosts, services, and other entities
tags_subtitle: Manage organization-wide tags for categorizing entities
topology_clickToInspect: Click on a node or edge to inspect it
topology_confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete topology {name}?
topology_conflictsDetectedBody: Some entities in this diagram no longer exist. Click the badge above to review changes before updating.
topology_dontFadeEdgesHelp: Show edges at full opacity at all times
topology_exportComplete: Export complete! Check your downloads folder.
topology_groupDockerBridgesHelp: Display Docker containers running on a single host in a single subnet grouping
topology_hideEdgeTypesHelp: Choose which edge types you would like to hide
topology_hidePortsHelp: Don't show open ports next to services
topology_hideServiceCategoriesHelp: Select service categories that should be hidden
topology_hideVmOnContainerHelp: If a docker container is running on a host that is a VM, don't indicate this on the container node
topology_leftZoneCategoriesHelp: Select service categories that should be displayed in the left zone of subnets they interface with
topology_leftZoneTitleHelp: Customize the label for each subnet's left zone
topology_lockTipBody: If you want to preserve this network state as a historical record, click 'Lock' to freeze this topology without refreshing.
topology_lockedInfoBody: Data can't be refreshed while this topology is locked. You can still move and resize nodes and edges, but you won't be able to make any other changes. Click the badge above to unlock and enable data refresh.
topology_multiselectHelp: Hold Ctrl (Windows/Linux) or Cmd (Mac) to select/deselect multiple options
topology_noTopologySelected: No topology selected. Create one to get started.
topology_removedWarning: These entities no longer exist in the network and will be removed from this diagram if you rebuild.
topology_selectParent: Select a parent to branch off of
topology_showGatewayInLeftZoneHelp: Display gateway services in the subnet's left zone
topology_staleDataBody: Entities have been updated, and the diagram layout may need to change to fit them.

users_emailHelp: Enter the email you would like to send this invite to, or leave empty to just generate a link
users_hasAllNetworks: Users with {permissions} permissions have access to all networks.
users_inviteInstructions: Select the permissions level for the new user, then generate an invite link. They can use it to register or join your organization.
users_networkAccessHelp: Select networks this user will have access to
users_noUsersSubtitle: Users will appear here once added
users_permissionsLevelHelp: Choose the access level for the invited user
users_sensitiveLinkWarning: Anyone with this link can join your organization with {permissions} permissions. Keep it secure and only share it with people you trust.
